item.description:
Cannonballs and Cranberries Program at Myles Standish State Forest

Come along for a walk around the Rocky Pond Cranberry Bogs on Wednesday, October 5th from 9:00am to 10:30am.  We will discuss and explore the history of the park, focusing on the use of the bogs.  You’ll learn about glaciation, kettle ponds, bog iron, Federal Furnace, cranberry agriculture, and the area's wildlife. Meet at the Rocky Pond Cranberry Bog parking lot on Bare Hill Road (on the way to Curlew Pond from Headquarters).  Dress for the weather and wear good walking shoes. (Water, snacks, sunscreen and bug spray are good to bring too.)

For adults.  Rain will cancel.  Call Amy at (508) 866-2580 x126 for more information.  For more park information, a park trail map and driving directions to the park, visit DCR's Myles Standish State Forest web page  

This free program is sponsored by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation & Recreation.
item.how_to_find_us: Parking lot is off Bare Hill Road

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: DCR's "Cranberries and Cannonballs"
